column4: i don't think changing it to auto would do anything ... for one, that isn't a valid option (man fstab, then type '/noauto' to find the section)
thanks I have used other distributions and was surprised at having to mount the floppy manually with sudo for the owners of the system
is mount removable media checked in sys > orefs > removable discs?
dont apologise I thank you for helping me
since it sounds like a generic question, you could also try #linuxhelp
thank you i will try that too
thank you for recommending #linuxhelp earlier, one person was very kind enough to solve the floppy issue for me thank you !
out of interest, what was the fix?
switching <type> in /etc/fstab from auto to vfat
simple enough :-) anyway, gald you fixed it
i'm very glad too my grandparents are grateful, and i have you to thank for your recommendation of channels for help!
